intro: Solenandra elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed screw pine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Indo-Pacific. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its spirally arranged, narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Solenandra elliptica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in coastal and saline environments. It plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and supporting local biodiversity.
